item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 7, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Introducing command And commandfor In HTML (99 points | 42 comments)
2. Vtm: Text-Based Desktop Environment (84 points | 10 comments)
3. Microsoft is plotting a future without OpenAI (31 points | 5 comments)
4. Strobelight: A profiling service built on open source technology (107 points | 35 comments)
5. Optimistic Locking in B-Trees (38 points | 6 comments)
6. Betting on the Pope was the original prediction market (82 points | 41 comments)
7. Anthropic raises $3.5B at $61.5B valuation (96 points | 74 comments)
8. Athena spacecraft declared dead after toppling over on moon (34 points | 26 comments)
9. Ladder: Self-improving LLMs through recursive problem decomposition (275 points | 85 comments)
10. Kraftful (YC S19) is hiring a founding eng to support our hockey-stick growth ( | hide)
11. AMD YOLO (44 points | 15 comments)
12. Show HN: IEMidi –  Cross-platform MIDI map editor for arbitrary controllers (18 points | 2 comments)
13. First Porn, Now Skin Cream? 'Age Verification' Bills Are Out of Control (27 points | 11 comments)
14. Matters Computational (2010) [pdf] (130 points | 13 comments)
15. Show HN: A big tech dev experience for an open source CMS (20 points | 18 comments)
16. Laser-based device can scan almost any sample of gas and tell you what's in it (64 points | 40 comments)
17. WB offers replacements, but no refunds, for DVDs rotting prematurely (8 points | 4 comments)
18. The features of Python's help() function (3 points | discuss)
19. Differentiable Logic Cellular Automata (387 points | 72 comments)
20. Why reading Martha C Nussbaum's philosophy is pure pleasure (67 points | 77 comments)
21. Succinct data structures (509 points | 82 comments)
22. A Scientific American bolt puzzle (35 points | 24 comments)
23. Discovery of fresco portraying Dionysian mysteries at Pompeii (135 points | 74 comments)
24. Anime fans stumbled upon a mathematical proof (468 points | 219 comments)
25. Why Quantum Engineering Is Emerging as a Distinct Industrial Sector (28 points | 21 comments)
26. Mistral OCR (1628 points | 401 comments)
27. What if America turned off Britain's weapons? (40 points | 34 comments)
28. Performance optimization, and how to do it wrong (46 points | 10 comments)
29. Speeding up computational lithography with the power and parallelism of GPUs (45 points | discuss)
30. Using GRPO to Beat o1, o3-mini and R1 at “Temporal Clue” (189 points | 51 comments)
